com.metreeca.xml.formats

Class XMLFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.metreeca.rest.Format<Document>
      • com.metreeca.xml.formats.XMLFormat

  • public final class XMLFormat
extends Format<Document>
    XML body format.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String MIME
      The default MIME type for XML message bodies ("application/xml").
      static Pattern MIMEPattern
      A pattern matching XML-based MIME types, for instance application/rss+xml.

        Parses a XML document.
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream the XML document is to be parsed from
        Returns:
        a value result containing the parsed XML document, if input was successfully parsed; an error result containing the parse exception, otherwise

      • get

        public Result<Document,Failure> get(Message<?> message)
        Description copied from class: Format
        Retrieves a body representation from a message.

        Processing failure should be reported using the following HTTP status codes:

        • Response.UnsupportedMediaType for missing bodies;
        • Response.BadRequest for malformed bodies, unless a more specific status code is available.

        The default implementation returns a failure reporting the Response.UnsupportedMediaType status, unless explicitly overridden.

        Overrides:
        get in class Format<Document>
        Parameters:
        message - the message whose body representation managed by this body format is to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the optional XML body representation of message, as retrieved from the reader supplied by its ReaderFormat representation, if one is present and the value of the Content-Type header is matched by MIMEPattern; a failure reporting the Response.UnsupportedMediaType status, otherwise

      • set

        public <M extends Message<M>> M set(M message,
                                    Document value)
        Configures the WriterFormat representation of message to write the XML value to the writer supplied by the accepted writer and sets the Content-Type header to "application/xml", unless already defined.
        Overrides:
        set in class Format<Document>
        Type Parameters:
        M - the type of message
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be configured to hold a body representation managed by this body format
        value - the body representation being configured for message by this body format
        Returns:
        the configured message
